title: What is the longest Kpop song? - Quora

response.answer_text: In my 30 years of hearing just about everything to come out of the Kpop industry, I’m fully aware of a number of tracks exceeding 8 minutes. Among them, a few songs by the late 신해철and his N.EX.T project comes to mind, and admittedly have to be considered mainstream Kpop, despite the experimental nature of the band/albums. They were certainly no Hongdae indie band. However, 김동률 is the king of long ballads, as both singer and composer. Which leads me to the following: I’m pretty sure that 천일동안 (1995) sung by 이승환 is the longest Kpop song (5:52) that was (1) mainstream Kpop ,(2) wasn’t a remake, and most importantly, (3) actually charted as the full-length LP version, something that radio show producers were not very fond of. However, by his 4th album he was already such a superstar, that this new ballad classic was certainly worth playing at its original length, especially because of the popularity of the song. Composed by 김동률.  When I toured in 이승환’s band (2005–2007, 2011) he’d have the interludes shortened by quite at bit, so the multiple final choruses would start sooner than on the album. However, with an extended instrumental to cloee the song, the total length would actually exceed 6 minutes, as did his show closer 어떻게 사랑이 그래요. Note: the final track off of the same album exceeds 9 minutes, but it was hardly a radio-friendly song and quite unknown. . Other lengthy mainstream hits worth mentioning: 김동률 - 답장  . Of course, probably the greatest and most structurally unorthodox ballad of 1994, also penned and sung by 김동률, 기억의 습작 by 전람회  . 야생화 by 뱍효신

I think as of now, Epik High’s song Born Hater is the longest song in Kpop being 5:27. I have a BTS trash channel called -namjooneroni- so please go watch my videos I would be very grateful.
